page.title: 03THE OLD SCHOOL
page.content: The old school was built one hundred and thirteen years ago by the Mary Wheatley Trust to educate village children. It consisted of two classrooms two storeys high and was used for one hundred years as a school. The Collins family who bought it did most of the conversion themselves and put in a floor to give them four bedrooms upstairs, whch are lit by flat windows set in the roof. One of the classrooms is now a living room downstairs and the other one is divided into three smaller rooms. They also installed central heating. Outside they filled in the bottom of the large windows and roughcast the outside brickwork. They removed the small toilets and used them to grow flowers in outside.
